rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I don't have much respect for Jim Ketch as a jazz band director or musician. I have never seen a jazz band director make the music so boring. It's as if he wants to prove to the faculty that he's "cool" rather than really trying to teach music to the students or trying to get the jazz band to play with emotion, soul or excitement.

Hes a nice guy as long as your soul continues to be sold to the music department, or at least as a trumpet professor. If you are a music major, and then change majors, your rapport with him will likely change for the far worse, . He is a great Jazz band director, and very helpful and adept in his field, just be wary of where your priorities lie.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dan is an absolute scream.  If you're a guy and have a fair talent for singing, join Glee.  You absolutely will not regret it.
Great professor and great guy.  He really challenges everybody to improve their singing and doesn't take mediocrity, but he always makes singing fun.  Great guy, guy group... join choir!

Probably the best professor I've ever had.  He really cares about his students and makes music fun.  If you want to take a music class that will help you in every aspect of your life, take one with him!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Took Piano Lit with Professor Yang. Great teacher. Really wants to see all her students succeed. She is very accommodating of students and, as long as you let her know ahead of time, you can miss class occasionally. Her lectures were clear and captivating. All in all, a great teacher, passionate about the subject material.

Dr. Yang is one of the best pianists and professors I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. She always finds ways to improve your skills as a musician and is there to help you achieve any musical feat you desire. I have seen so much progress  and development in myself as an individual since taking lessons with her.
